title: Top 10 Australian suburbs with the best potential price growth
text:
Investors and homebuyers hunting for the best capital growth suburbs in the country now have a new list at hand.

SuburbGrowth.com.au has crunched the numbers and come up with the top 10 Australian suburbs in major markets with forecast median house price growth of up to 30 per cent over the next three years.

By percentage growth, the inner Melbourne suburb of Balaclava is tipped to have its median house price increase by 30.3 per cent. The analysis forecasts Balaclava’s current median house price of $1.07 million to increase by nearly $325,000.

Jeremy Sheppard is director of research for Select Residential Property Research Group, the company behind SuburbGrowth.com.au, and explains that the research identifies areas with sound market fundamentals where the principals of supply and demand are putting upward pressure on prices.

The top 10 predicted price performers are in Victoria, NSW, Queensland, South Australia and the ACT with current median house prices ranging from $396,000 to nearly $1.3 million.

“The research highlights that each major region has suburbs with price potential, regardless of what the market cycle is doing at the time,” he adds.

Josh Stirling of McGrath St Kilda has sold several Balaclava residences in recent years and says the huge price growth prediction sounds a bit too good to be true, but he does have high hopes for the suburb.

“If anywhere in Melbourne is going to do it, it’d be Balaclava. It probably isn’t going to jump by 30 per cent in the next three years — that’s pretty ambitious.

It definitely does feel like things are on the rise, but it’s been a pretty stable return.

Honestly, I can’t see any market booming to that degree, but I hope it does — it’s a great suburb.

In Mr Stirling’s opinion, Balaclava is undervalued considering its surrounded by popular “blue chip” suburbs like St Kilda, Elwood and Elsternwick.

“When a buyer is priced out of their ideal suburb, they don’t want to venture too far away. So, we’ve certainly seen a lot of that around here. The price gap between Balaclava and the other waterside suburbs is getting smaller,” he says.

The number two spot on the list, but the top performer for potential capital growth by dollar value, is Narraweena in Sydney’s Northern Beaches region.

“The research forecasts a $386,000 change in its median house price, so it would be wise to not delay if you’re interested in buying there anytime soon,” he says.

Mario Esposito, selling agent with McGrath Dee Why, has sold multiple homes in Narraweena and calls the suburb home himself.

“The thing with Narraweena is that it’s been underwhelmed for long time, and we’re coming from a lower base, to be fair. It’s a sought after location, that did take a hit over the last 12 months as have a lot of Sydney suburbs,” he says.

“Homes in the area that would have sold for around $1.4 million in the peak around 2017 have more recently been getting closer to $1.2 million. But now we’re starting to claw back.

So 29.7 per cent is great, but I do believe certain pockets will perform better than others,” he explains.

Helensburgh, located about halfway between Sydney and Wollongong, came in third. The study forecast the suburb will achieve 28.6 per cent median house price growth over the three-year period.

“Helensburgh’s location as well as affordability compared to Sydney are just some of the reasons why this suburb is poised for growth,” Mr Sheppard says.

The research then placed Fullerton in Adelaide at number four with a predicted growth of 28 per cent, or $255,000.

Mr Sheppard says city-fringe suburb is one of Adelaide’s most desirable locations with demand from owner occupiers likely to remain strong.

When it came to fifth place, Mr Sheppard picked St Albans Park in Geelong, a region that continues to benefit from its commutable distance from Melbourne and affordability.

“The research found that the median house price in St Albans Park is forecast to grow by 27.5 per cent or nearly $110,000,” Mr Sheppard says.
description: Investors and homebuyers hunting for the best capital growth suburbs in the country now have a new list at hand — Top 10 suburbs with the best potential price growth.
